intro: Palicourea heterantha, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, round, and often have a star-like appearance when mature. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in folk medicine.
